resources.name: crop_data

fields.name: plot
fields.title: Plot
fields.description: Original plots established in 1877

fields.name: sub_plot
fields.title: Sub-plot
fields.description: Some plots were divided into a and b halves to test different treatments from 1882. See notes for more details

fields.name: sub_sub_plot
fields.title: Sub sub-plot
fields.description: Some sub-plots were divided into i and ii halves, from 1905. Sub-plot a divided into i and ii (formerly known as aa), sub-plot b into i and ii (formerly known as bb), to test residual effects of fertilizer N.  See notes 1 and 2 for more details.

fields.name: year_of_1st_split
fields.title: Year of first split
fields.description: Year in which plot was divided into a and b sub-plots, if appropriate (plots 1, 6 and 7 were not split)

fields.name: year_of_2nd_split
fields.title: Year of second split
fields.description: Year in which sub-plot was divided into i and ii sub-sub-plots, if appropriate

fields.name: harvest_year
fields.title: Year in which crop harvested
fields.description: Year in which the crop was harvested. It will generally have been sown the previous year.

fields.name: fertilizer_code
fields.title: fertilizer and manure treatment code
fields.description: Code describing the fertilizer or manure applied in that harvest year

fields.name: lime_factor_level
fields.title: lime factor level
fields.description: Code for the lime treatment applied to that sub sub-plot

fields.name: lime_rate
fields.title: Amount of lime applied
fields.description: Amount of lime applied to that sub sub-plot in that harvest year

fields.name: lime_date
fields.title: Date lime applied
fields.description: Date the lime was applied, month only

fields.name: fym_factor_level
fields.title: FYM factor level
fields.description: Code for the FYM factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: fym_amount
fields.title: Amount of FYM applied
fields.description: Approximate amount of FYM (farmyard manure) applied in that harvest year, fresh weight.  Ploughed  in in February before sowing 1877-88; applied to the crop in March or April 1889-1926

fields.name: fym_n
fields.title: FYM N
fields.description: Approximate amount of N in the FYM applied in that harvest year

fields.name: rape_cake_factor_level
fields.title: Rape Cake factor level
fields.description: Code for the rape cake factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: rape_cake_n
fields.title: Rape cake N
fields.description: Amount of N applied as rape cake in that harvest year

fields.name: n_factor_level
fields.title: N factor level
fields.description: Code for the inorganic nitrogen fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: fertilizer_n_amount
fields.title: Fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Total inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in this harvest year. This does not include N in FYM or rape cake

fields.name: p_factor_level
fields.title: P factor level
fields.description: Code for the phosphorous fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: p_amount
fields.title: Fertilizer P amount
fields.description: Total inorganic phosphorous fertilizer applied in this harvest year. This does not include P in FYM or rape cake

fields.name: k_factor_level
fields.title: K factor level
fields.description: Code for the potassium fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: k_amount
fields.title: Fertilizer K amount
fields.description: Total inorganic potassium fertilizer applied in this harvest year. This does not include K in FYM or rape cake

fields.name: na_factor_level
fields.title: Na factor level
fields.description: Code for the sodium fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: na_amount
fields.title: Fertilizer Na amount
fields.description: Total inorganic sodium fertilizer applied in this harvest year. This does not include Na in FYM or rape cake

fields.name: mg_factor_level
fields.title: Mg factor level
fields.description: Code for the magnesium fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: mg_amount
fields.title: Fertilizer Mg amount
fields.description: Total inorganic magnesium fertilizer applied in this harvest year. This does not include Mg in FYM or rape cake

fields.name: sow_date
fields.title: Sowing date
fields.description: Date the crop was sown, in the spring of the year the crop was harvested. Harvest date not recorded

fields.name: cultivar
fields.title: Barley cultivar
fields.description: Barley cultivar or variety

fields.name: area_ha
fields.title: Cropped area
fields.description: Plot area. Each full plot was 0.10 hectare, some were then divided into half (0.05 hectare) and then quarters (0.025 hectare).

fields.name: grain
fields.title: Grain yield
fields.description: Harvested barley grain yield at field moisture content (approximately 85% dry matter, but this was not measured).

fields.name: straw
fields.title: Straw yield
fields.description: Harvested barley straw yield at field moisture content (approximately 85% dry matter, but this was not measured). This does not include stubble. Dervied from total produce less grain.

fields.name: grain_%_n
fields.title: Grain %N
fields.description: Grain percentage N content, of grain dried at 100 degrees C, assumed to be at 100% dry matter. No data for 1877-1882.

fields.name: note_id
fields.title: Note identification
fields.description: Whether notes are applied or not. See notes_data for details

resources.title: crop yield data
resources.description: The main data table containing annual spring barley grain and straw yield data for all plots and sub-plots  of the Woburn Continuous Barley experiment, 1877-1926. Also grain N content for many plots and years. The first crop was sown in the spring of 1877 and harvested in 1877. Also details of all fertilizer, manure and lime treatments, and other agronomic information, including sowing date, plot size and cultivars. Originally 11 plots (1-11), some were divided into sub-plots (a and b) from 1882, and again into sub sub-plots (i and ii) from 1905. To allow comparison of the different treatments, yields are shown for all 50 years for all sub-plots. See notes_data for full details.

Note at different periods of the experiment N was variously applied in autumn or spring and applied in a single application or split applications. Timings and amounts of N applied are indicated in the crop_data table in the fields autumn_n_kg, autumn_n_date, spring1_n_kg, spring1_n_date, spring2_n_kg and spring2_n_date

name: woburn-continuous-barley-experiment-yields-1877-1926
title: Woburn Continuous Barley Experiment yields 1877-1926
description:
### Abstract
This dataset contains the annual grain and straw yields of the Woburn Continuous Barley experiment, 1877-1926. Also grain %N for most plots and years. Details of the fertilizer, manure and lime treatments are also included.  There was a parallel experiment at Woburn testing the same treatments on the yield of continuous winter wheat. This experiment also mirrored the continuous spring barley experiment on the silty clay loam soil at Hoosfield, Rothamsted, started in 1852. The soil at Woburn contained little free calcium carbonate, and soil pH was 6.1 in 1876. Consequently, where ammonium sulphate was applied (plots 2, 5 and 8) the soil soon became acidic and yields declined markedly within 20 years. These were the first experiments in the UK where lime was applied to try to correct soil acidity.
### Methods
This experiment tested different fertilizer, manure and lime treatments on the yield of continuous spring barley grown on a sandy loam soil at Woburn. Originally 11 plots (1-11), some were divided into sub-plots (a and b) from 1882, and into sub sub-plots (i and ii) from 1905, to test different treatments, mainly with and without lime.  To allow comparison of the different treatments, yields are shown for all 50 years for each sub-plot.
### Technical Info
Grain and straw yields at field moisture content, approximately 85%, though this was not recorded. Grain % N content measured in grain dried at 100 degrees C, assumed to be 100% dry matter.  Grain %N not recorded for all plots. Harvest dates not recorded.
### Other
Yield data taken from Russell E. J. and Voelcker  J.A. (1936) *Fifty years of field experiments at the Woburn Experimental Station*. Rothamsted Monographs on Agricultural Science, Longmans, Green and Co., London. Appendix tables.
### Provenance
Individual plot yields are taken from Russell and Voelcker (1936) appendix tables. The treatment details were taken from [Glendining 2022](https://doi.org/10.23637/wxb6-treats-01) Glendining (2022).  This frictionless dataset of combined yield and treatment data was compiled by M Glendining and checked by S Perryman, May 2022.
### Quality
In accordance with the Joint Code of Practice for Research at Rothamsted, data processing in e-RA follow rigorous standard operating procedures to ensure the quality and correctness of data collected in the field through to depositing in the e-RA database. To ensure quality control during data inputting, the data sets were typed on two separate occasions (double data entry). During the second typing (verification) the data values were compared with those typed on the earlier occasion, and any discrepancies were resolved before verification continued. This procedure also set out how to handle situations where the written records were illegible or ambiguous. This procedure avoided visual checking of data, which can be very inaccurate.

contributors.organization: Computational and Analytical Sciences, Rothamsted Research
